page.title: 01Kinver and the Stour Valley
page.content: The area is divided by the River Stour and the Staffordshire and Worcestershire Canal which run side by side through the broad green valley which separates the West Midland conurbation from the beautiful hills of Kinver Edge. The block is predominantly rural and agricultural with a mix of arable and pastoral farming. The main settlement is Kinver with a population of about 8,000. Half the village lies in this block and the remainder in the adjacent western block. There are two or three more villages or hamlets along the river, principally Stourton and Whittington. Most people go to work in the towns of Dudley, Stourbridge, Wolverhampton and Birmingham.
